A mirror, especially one used in a telescope.

A bright, lustrous patch of colour found on the wings of ducks and some other birds, usually situated on the distal portions of the secondary quills, and much more brilliant in the adult male than in the female.
A lookout place.
A short poetical composition proper to be set to music or sung; a lyric poem; especially, now, a poem characterized by sustained noble sentiment and appropriate dignity of style.

To become red in the face (and sometimes experience an associated feeling of warmth), especially due to shyness, shame, excitement, or embarrassment.

To become red.
To suffuse with a blush; to redden; to make rosy.
To change skin color in the face (to a particular shade).

definitions.definition: To express or make known by blushing.
definitions.example: Looking at me with a knowing glare, she blushed her discomfort with the situation.

definitions.definition: To have a warm and delicate colour, like some roses and other flowers.
definitions.example: The garden was full of blossoms that blushed in myriad shades to form a beautiful carpet of color.

definitions.definition: To glance with the eye, cast a glance.
(heading) Emotionally negative.
Sated, having had one's fill; satisfied, weary.

Dignified, serious, grave.
Naughty; troublesome; wicked.

definitions.definition: Soggy (to refer to pastries).
Heavy; weighty; ponderous; close; hard.

A small swimming pool that can be used also as a spa.

definitions.definition: The act or result of arranging something into a code; the act of setting down a body of knowledge in a systematic way.
The act of moving from one thing to another.

A sequence obtained by adding or multiplying each term by a constant.
Development, increase, evolution.
Chord progression

The quality or state of being inferior.
An inferior value or quality.
An inferior power.
The quality of being a competitive disadvantage.
To make smooth or shiny by rubbing; to polish; to shine.

definitions.definition: To shine forth; to brighten; to become smooth and glossy, as from swelling or filling out; hence, to grow large.
(metaphoric) To make appear positive and highly respected.
Polished, made shiny by rubbing (especially with a burnisher).
Blazing, bright.
An abnormally increased acidity of the blood.

One who gathers eggs.
Any of various species of moth, especially the oak egger-moth, Lasiocampa quercus.
One who eggs or incites.

definitions.definition: To become bigger, especially due to being engorged.

definitions.definition: To grow gradually in force or loudness.

definitions.definition: To encircle.

definitions.definition: To invest (a person) with a belt as part of a formal ceremony such as knighthood.

definitions.definition: To scream or sing in a loud manner.

definitions.definition: To drink quickly, often in gulps.

definitions.definition: To hit someone or something.

definitions.definition: To hit a pitched ball a long distance, usually for a home run.

definitions.definition: To move very fast

definitions.definition: A beating with a belt.
A thorough defeat; a thrashing.
A system of beltwork, as in a conveyor or other mechanical device.
The material from which belts for machinery are made.
Very good; exceptional (can also be used adverbially)
